Portal is a unique puzzle game that will bend your mind in ways you never thought were possible. Although it is a short game, Portal will have you at the edge of your seat just waiting to see what crazy experiment GLaDOS has in store for you. Don't let the 3 hour main quest deprive you from buying this game. Portal is a enjoyable experience that I will come back to. 

And yes you will be baked and then there will be cake.

This game... This game... This game... This game has to be one of my favorite games ever. Where would my game library be without this game? This game, its puzzles are, well, perfect. Just perfect. The story is so well written, and I got so many laughs from this game that I didn't know when it'd stop. It was so suprisingly short, but that was honestly no problem to me.
I have really enjoyed this game. It has interesting puzzles which are neither too simple nor too difficult.

i loved the puzzles in this game although i did kinda rage at the turrets :D

Mam na karku około 25 lat korzystania z rozrywki, którą dają komputery; grałem w dziesiątki gier przez ten czas- od ośmiobitowych platformówek, wyścigów, strategii aż po współczesny FPSy. Jeśli miałbym wskazać grę, która przez ten czas mnie najbardziej oczarowała, byłby to właśnie Portal. Łączy elementy wielu gatunków, a jednak mimo wymieszania wszystkich growych barw nie otrzymujemy szarej papki a zupełnie nową, pełnoprawną barwę, której nigdy wcześniej nikt nie widział na oczy. Świat gry na pierwszy rzut oka zapowiada się sterylnie, testowanie portali to wspaniała zabawa, jednak ta zabawa szybko się kończy i zaczyna się prawdziwa przygoda. Gdyby w Portalu nie było dialogów, podpisów, napisów na ścianach w grze ani instrukcji obsługi, i tak każdy by zrozumiał fabułę i mechanikę gry, bo jest ona bajecznie prosta. Prosta mechanika ułatwi nam rozwiązywanie nieprostych zagadek, które z niewinnych gier w ramach testu przerodzą się w walkę o przeżycie. Ale koniec spojlerów.

Po prostu trzeba w to zagrać.
Legendary, and deserving of its near-universal praise.

Portal and Portal 2 are the best puzzle games I've ever played. Portal is a good challenge that requires you to think, but manages to be pretty fun and not make your brain explode at the same time, and it also has a story. And it's made by Valve so you know you have to buy it.

[h1]Summary (TL;DR)[/h1]

Portal is among one of the best games in my library, I am honestly suprised I didn't play this game sooner given how much I've heard about this game before. The storyline was very enjoyable, the graphics are great (even compared to the graphics for games in 2015) and the mechanics were probably the most fun to play around with.

This game is well priced, and there's a ton of mods to enhance your game experience even further!

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Great storyline
    [*]Great graphics
    [*]Amazing mechanics
    [*]Progressively gets more challenging
    [*]A pretty universal game, there's something here for every type of gamer.
    [*]Challenging achievements
    [*]Controller support
    [*]Has subtitles 
[/list]

[h1]Neutral Points[/h1]
[list]
    [*]I felt the storyline was a bit short, but I'm not counting that against it.
    [*]Cake song was awesome- See end credits.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
    [*]The first game to ever make me feel motion sickness from messing around with the portals
[/list]

[h1]Rating[/h1]
9/10

This game has everything you could want from a puzzle game. Floating Hadouken Balls. Automatic Shooting Cocoons. Cubes. Radios all playing the same song. Walls that go from white to polluted brown. Portals (No Way!). And most importantly, Buttons. So, (If you are from the 1 millionth of the population on Earth who hasn't played it already) why not give a shot to a game with a 2 hour storyline + challenges. You won't regret it when you finally get a 360 noscope a cube across a room. It's so worth it.

Portal is a truly intelligent game with clever game mechanics revolving around the use of portals(obviously), which function to bring you from one place to another without travel inbetween the two portals. The story of the game is interesting, and will keep you hooked until the end. Which is good, as the game only lasts a grand total of about 2-4 hours, depending on your ability to master this concept. I would highly reccomend investing in buying a copy(be it virtual or physical) of both this game and its sequel. However, do expect this one's load times and graphics to be a little dated compared to today's next-gen graphical engines.

Pros:
+Brilliant, puzzle-based gameplay
+An intruiging story
+Easy-to-grasp concepts
+Decent replayability for speedrunners/completionists

Cons:
-Graphics and loadtime a bit dated by today's standards
-Short playtime, especially if you plan to go for a second playthrough

Rating:
9.5/10

Potal...
Un chef d'oeuvre d'innovation et de narration. Graphiquement par contre c'est clairement pas beau, les textures sont baveuses et la modélisation assez archaïque. Le gameplay quand à lui est un des plus innovants de ces dernières années, l'utilisation des portails/cubes est extrèmement intelligente et jouissive!
Le scénario n'est pas complexe mais est très prenant, la voix de glados guidant vos pas et devenant de plus en plus menaçante. La fin est superbe et le personnage de Glados est très charismatique. Le jeux à malheureusement une durée de vie médiocre et vous l'aurez finit en 2-3 heures... Dommage!
Sinon, un jeu que vous devez posséder dans votre bibliothèque Steam!
One of the greatest games I have ever played. Phenomenally, and tediously crafted work of art.

Anyone else agrees that valve make really depressing games? The source engine has great physics but always looked strangley dull to me. Anyone else realise no matter what game you play, there is always some sort of nature involved. In 99% of games you will at least see grass, trees, plants, the sky, the sun or at least other characters. But not this game. Portal has no life in it at all, and no one else in the game at all (the only enemies you will see are the turrets which are only in very few segments). You can't even see the sky, you are completely trapped and deprived  in a colourless building which is why the companion cube, turrets and glados are so memorable because they are the only things you are exposed to in the entire game. Now if this was not done the right way, Portal could have been a very boring game, but since the innovation of the portals and glados and all the other highlights are added in, those things are going to get full attention from the player since nothing else is in focus since everything else is so bleak, which also why the escape sequence is so much fun, because you want to get out of this place and back outside That is fucking genius!!! Analysis OVER!
10/10
Corto pero divertido

I played the second part first, so maybe my review will be a little odd.  First of everything both Portal games are equally good, however I think that Portal 1 is a little hardest due the angles, something that in Portal 2 I don’t remember had to consider, yet are not impossible and the feeling of passing the puzzles are nice. 
The history is … well, sarcastically bad but you don’t  need to worry about it (And is begin to be developed in Portal 2).  

In short words, this game of puzzles and labyrinths is nice,  the Steam achievements and special  complex level can give it a little more of life and its sequel  adopt everything made it good and did even better.
